content.body: That said, I'd love if we could have a comparison predicate configurable when building the map, but to no shoot down performance, we may need to expose `SameValueZero` as a predicate the same way `SameValue` is exposed as `Object.is`, so that not providing a comparison predicate isn't magical.
content.formatted_body: That said, I'd love if we could have a comparison predicate configurable when building the map, but to no shoot down performance, we may need to expose SameValueZero as a predicate the same way SameValue is exposed as Object.is, so that not providing a comparison predicate isn't magical.

org.matrix.msc1767.message.body: That said, I'd love if we could have a comparison predicate configurable when building the map, but to no shoot down performance, we may need to expose `SameValueZero` as a predicate the same way `SameValue` is exposed as `Object.is`, so that not providing a comparison predicate isn't magical.

That said, I'd love if we could have a comparison predicate configurable when building the map, but to no shoot down performance, we may need to expose SameValueZero as a predicate the same way SameValue is exposed as Object.is, so that not providing a comparison predicate isn't magical.

content.body: yeah in that case the only other alternative I can think of if would be providing mapping functions that transform keys before insertion, probably with a SameValue based caching mechanism to be robust against instability of the transform function if the initial key is already known
